record.title: MORNING BUSINESS
record.chair: Under the previous order, the Senate will proceed to a period of morning business for up to 2 hours, with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each, with the time equally divided and controlled between the two leaders or their designees, with the majority controlling the first hour and the Republicans controlling the next hour.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the following Senators be permitted to speak for up to 5 minutes: Myself, McCaskill, Feinstein, Landrieu, Murray, Boxer, Stabenow, Klobuchar, and Lincoln.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
